column1: #Text=The Sr2Co2GexMnxFe12−2xO22, (where X = 0.0, 0.1, 0.2, 0.3, 0.4 and 0.5) polycrystalline nanomaterials were fabricated by simple sol–gel process.
#Text=The required amount of metal salts (given in table 1) were dissolved in deionized water and stirred on magnetic stirring hot plate at 50 °C for half an hour.
#Text=The ethylene glycol as a chelating agent was mixed with the metal salt solution keeping the ratio 1:1.5 between metals and chelating agent.
#Text=The pH of the resulted sol was maintained at 7.0 by drop wise addition of 2 M ammonia solution.
#Text=Sol was heated at 90 ˚C to evaporate the mixture and finally converted in to viscous brown gel.
#Text=The gel was burnt into fine powder at 300 °C.
#Text=Finally the resulted powder was annealed for 10 h at 1050 °C to obtained single Y-type hexagonal phase [17].
#Text=During the preparation, in fact a series of the following chemical reactions may take place.
